Test (Please remove this if it got posted)

Done seeding after 1.06 TB uploaded ;)

Anyway, if you have problems viewing this movie then please read the guide below.

1. Download MakeMKV (First result on google)
2. Install it.
3. Open it.
4. Press (CTRL + O) or browse (File > Open files)
5. Browse to the movie directory.
6. Browse to (AVATAR_CE_D1 > BDMV)
7. Open (index.bdmv)
8. Untick everything.
9. Tick one of the following movies.

- Extended Collector's Edition Disc 1 - 56 chapter(s), 36.3 GB = Avatar
- Extended Collector's Edition Disc 1 - 72 chapter(s), 38.7 GB = Avatar Collector's Edition
- Extended Collector's Edition Disc 1 - 74 chapter(s), 40.3 GB = Avatar Extended Collector's Edition
- The rest is just junk. It's not any extras or something. They are on Disc 2 and 3.
- The complete file size for the extended collector's edition after conversion is 34.3 GB.

10. Choose output folder.
11. Press on the hard drive to the right with a green arrow pointing at it labeled (Make MKV)
12. If you want the extras. Then do the same procedure for disc 2 and 3 but don't untick anything.

- The complete file size for the extras after conversion is 87.9 GB.
- The complete file size for all the discs after conversion is 122.2 GB.

13. Download VLC Media Player (First result on google)
14. Install it.
15. Enjoy.

- To change the volume scroll up and down.
- To change the subtitles browse to (Video > Subtitles Track)
- The second English subtitles track is for Na'vi translation only.
- To change the audio language browse to (Audio > Audio Track)
- To change the audio device browse to (Audio > Audio Device)
- If the movie doesn't fill your entire screen in fullscreen mode. You might want to change the aspect ratio.
- To change the aspect ratio browse to (Video > Aspect Ratio)

Well got down loaded, finally.  Converted the folders on disc 1 to an .iso so that I could burn em to disc.  Did a check first on on Intervideo BD player.  Won't play - Region B!  No big, ripped with Anydvd to iso, tried again with intervideo, no go.

Basically Anydvd HD is unable to make these discs region free so..... if your in the US and have bought your player here (region A) don't bother with burning them, you won't be able to play em.  That said, If someone has done it, I'm all ears :)

Firstly i cant understand why any1 would need a single movie file this big. So in other words if you don't know what you are doing, probably have no business downloading this torrent. Also to the people who were wondering how to watch a movie on their TV, get an HDMI cord, they save lives.
